name: Roo.dd.DragDropMgr
desc:
DragDropMgr is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for
all DragDrop items in the window.  Generally, you will not call
this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could
be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

methods.name: isDragDrop
methods.desc:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been
registered as a drag drop item.

params.name: id
params.desc: the element id to check

returns.desc:
true if this element is a DragDrop item,
false otherwise

methods.name: getRelated
methods.desc:
Returns the drag and drop instances that are in all groups the
passed in instance belongs to.

params.name: p_oDD
params.desc: the obj to get related data for

params.name: bTargetsOnly
params.desc: if true, only return targetable objs

methods.name: getScrollLeft
methods.desc: Gets the scrollLeft

methods.name: regDragDrop
methods.desc:
Each DragDrop instance must be registered with the DragDropMgr.
This is executed in DragDrop.init()

params.name: oDD
params.desc: the DragDrop object to register

params.name: sGroup
params.desc: the name of the group this element belongs to

methods.name: handleWasClicked
methods.desc:
Recursively searches the immediate parent and all child nodes for
the handle element in order to determine wheter or not it was
clicked.

params.name: node
params.desc: the html element to inspect

methods.name: refreshCache
methods.desc: Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is: Roo.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups); Alternatively: Roo.dd.DragDropMgr.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true});

params.name: groups
params.desc: an associative array of groups to refresh

methods.name: getCss
methods.desc:
Returns the style property for the DOM element (i.e.,
document.getElById(id).style)
methods.deprecated: This has been deprecated: use Roo.getDom instead

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the elment to get

returns.desc: The style property of the element

methods.name: swapNode
methods.desc:
Swap two nodes.  In IE, we use the native method, for others we
emulate the IE behavior

params.name: n1
params.desc: the first node to swap

params.name: n2
params.desc: the other node to swap

methods.name: stopEvent
methods.desc:
Utility to stop event propagation and event default, if these
features are turned on.

params.name: e
params.desc: the event as returned by this.getEvent()

methods.name: lock
methods.desc: Lock all drag and drop functionality

methods.name: moveToEl
methods.desc:
Sets the x/y position of an element to the location of the
target element.

params.name: moveEl
params.desc: The element to move

params.name: targetEl
params.desc: The position reference element

methods.name: unlock
methods.desc: Unlock all drag and drop functionality

methods.name: getDDById
methods.desc: Returns the DragDrop instance for a given id

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the DragDrop object

returns.desc: the drag drop object, null if it is not found

methods.name: isLegalTarget
methods.desc:
Returns true if the specified dd target is a legal target for
the specifice drag obj

params.name: the
params.desc: drag obj

params.name: the
params.desc: target

returns.desc:
true if the target is a legal target for the
dd obj

methods.name: isTypeOfDD
methods.desc:
My goal is to be able to transparently determine if an object is
typeof DragDrop, and the exact subclass of DragDrop.  typeof
returns "object", oDD.constructor.toString() always returns
"DragDrop" and not the name of the subclass.  So for now it just
evaluates a well-known variable in DragDrop.

params.name: the
params.desc: object to evaluate

methods.name: startDrag
methods.desc:
Fired when either the drag pixel threshol or the mousedown hold
time threshold has been met.

params.name: x
params.desc: {int} the X position of the original mousedown

params.name: y
params.desc: {int} the Y position of the original mousedown

methods.name: getStyle
methods.desc: Returns the specified element style property
methods.deprecated: This has been deprecated: use Roo.lib.Dom.getStyle

params.name: el
params.desc: the element

params.name: styleProp
params.desc: the style property

returns.desc: The value of the style property

methods.name: getPosX
methods.desc: Returns the X position of an html element
methods.deprecated: This has been deprecated: use Roo.lib.Dom.getX instead

params.name: el
params.desc: the element for which to get the position

methods.name: getPosY
methods.desc: Returns the Y position of an html element
methods.deprecated: This has been deprecated: use Roo.lib.Dom.getY instead

params.name: el
params.desc: the element for which to get the position

methods.name: isLocked
methods.desc: Is drag and drop locked?

returns.desc: True if drag and drop is locked, false otherwise.

methods.name: getBestMatch
methods.desc:
Helper function for getting the best match from the list of drag
and drop objects returned by the drag and drop events when we are
in INTERSECT mode.  It returns either the first object that the
cursor is over, or the object that has the greatest overlap with
the dragged element.

params.name: dds
params.desc:
The array of drag and drop objects
targeted

methods.name: getLocation
methods.desc:
Returns a Region object containing the drag and drop element's position
and size, including the padding configured for it

params.name: oDD
params.desc:
the drag and drop object to get the
                      location for

returns.desc:
a Region object representing the total area
                            the element occupies, including any padding
                            the instance is configured for.

methods.name: isHandle
methods.desc:
Utility function to determine if a given element has been
registered as a drag drop handle for the given Drag Drop object.

params.name: id
params.desc: the element id to check

returns.desc:
true if this element is a DragDrop handle, false
otherwise

methods.name: getScrollTop
methods.desc: Gets the scrollTop

methods.name: numericSort
methods.desc: Numeric array sort function

methods.name: regHandle
methods.desc:
Each DragDrop handle element must be registered.  This is done
automatically when executing DragDrop.setHandleElId()

params.name: sDDId
params.desc: the DragDrop id this element is a handle for

params.name: sHandleId
params.desc:
the id of the element that is the drag
handle

methods.name: getElement
methods.desc: Returns the actual DOM element
methods.deprecated: This has been deprecated: use Roo.getDom instead

params.name: id
params.desc: the id of the elment to get

methods.name: verifyEl
methods.desc:
This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM.  The
main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove
drag and drop objects from the DOM.  IE provides an 'unspecified
error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element

params.name: el
params.desc: the element to check

returns.desc: true if the element looks usable
